service.name: Youth Allowance
service.description: Financial help for people aged 16 to 24 years who are studying full-time, undertaking a full-time Australian Apprenticeship, training, looking for work or sick.

Dimension.name: Students and trainees
Dimension.desc: Support for those who are studying, training or undertaking an Australian Apprenticeship.

Dimension.name: Job seekers
Dimension.desc: We Fer income support if you are looking for work, completing approved studies or have a disability and are looking for work.

Dimension.name: Centrelink
Dimension.desc: Delivering a range of payments and services for people at times of major change.

Dimension.name: Human Services
Dimension.desc: We deliver social and health-related payments and services

subService.name: Relocation Scholarship
subService.desc: Relocation Scholarship (RS) is intended to assist students who have to live away from home to study with the cost of establishing and maintaining accommodation away from their usual home in order to undertake qualifying higher education studies.

subService.name: Youth Allowance Apprentice
subService.desc: Youth Allowance Apprentice is an income support payment for Australian Apprentices (apprentices or trainees) aged 16 - 24 undertaking or intending to undertake an approved course of study which aims to: ensure eligible young people receive adequate levels of income while studying or training; encourage young people to choose further education or training over job search if they do not have sufficient skills to obtain long-term employment; and encourage young people to undertake a range of activities that will promote entry into employment. Some 15 year olds may qualify for Youth Allowance (YA) and some full-time students and Australian Apprentices continue to qualify for YA after they turn 25. Assistance for students or Australian Apprentices aged 25 years or over is generally provided under Austudy.

subService.name: Youth Allowance Jobseeker
subService.desc: Youth Allowance Jobseeker (YNST) is an income support payment for young Australians generally aged 16 - 21 which aims to: ensure eligible young people receive adequate levels of income while studying, training, looking for, or preparing for, paid employment, encourage young people to choose further education or training over job search if they do not have sufficient skills to obtain long-term employment, and encourage young people to undertake a range of activities that will promote entry into employment. YNST may also be paid to customers who are: under 22 years, and temporarily unable to work due to an illness or injury or have claimed Disability Support Pension (DSP) and are awaiting the assessment of the claim or are under 16 years of age and independent.

subService.name: Youth Allowance Student
subService.desc: Youth Allowance Student (YFST) is an income support payment for students aged 16 - 24 undertaking or intending to undertake an approved course of study which aims to: ensure eligible young people receive adequate levels of income while studying or training; encourage young people to choose further education or training over job search if they do not have sufficient skills to obtain long-term employment; and encourage young people to undertake a range of activities that will promote entry into employment. Some 15 year olds may qualify for Youth Allowance (YA) and some full-time students and Australian Apprentices continue to qualify for YA after they turn 25. Assistance for students or Australian Apprentices aged 25 years or over is generally provided under Austudy.
